text: Is there a way to get "the module in which this function is defined" inside a function? I mean I can of course read the code, but is there a way to infer that dynamically?

elements.text: Is there a way to get "the module in which this function is defined" inside a function? I mean I can of course read the code, but is there a way to infer that dynamically?

text:
```help?> @which
  @which

  Applied to a function or macro call, it evaluates the arguments to the specified call, and returns the Method object
  for the method that would be called for those arguments. Applied to a variable, it returns the module in which the
  variable was bound. It calls out to the which function.

julia> @which range
Base```

elements.text:
help?> @which
  @which

  Applied to a function or macro call, it evaluates the arguments to the specified call, and returns the Method object
  for the method that would be called for those arguments. Applied to a variable, it returns the module in which the
  variable was bound. It calls out to the which function.

julia> @which range
Base

text:
```julia> Base.eval(quote
           function boo()
               @__MODULE__
           end
       end)
boo (generic function with 1 method)```
```julia> Base.boo()
Base

julia> import Base: boo

julia> boo()
Base```

elements.text:
julia> Base.boo()
Base

julia> import Base: boo

julia> boo()
Base

text: <@U67SCG4HG> I think you need to get a reference to the current function to use `parentmodule`. I'm not sure how to figure that out.

elements.text: I think you need to get a reference to the current function to use
. I'm not sure how to figure that out.

text:
So say I have
```module Foo
   function bar()
      x = ....
      println(x)
    end
end```
I want that to print "Foo"

elements.text:
module Foo
   function bar()
      x = ....
      println(x)
    end
end

text: so `x=@___MODULE___` seems to be what I want?

elements.text: seems to be what I want?

text:
```julia> module Foo
          function bar()
             x = @__MODULE__
             println(x)
           end
       end
Main.Foo

julia> using .Foo

julia> Foo.bar()
Main.Foo```

elements.text:
julia> module Foo
          function bar()
             x = @__MODULE__
             println(x)
           end
       end
Main.Foo

julia> using .Foo

julia> Foo.bar()
Main.Foo
